english: structural particle; to get, obtain; must, have to

etymology.description: 貝 “cowry” + 又 “hand”; 彳 was sometimes added to show the cowry was picked up on the road.
etymology.interpretation: A hand taking a cowry shell (money) pictures the act of obtaining valuables, yielding meanings like ‘to get’ or ‘to gain.’ The added step/road element highlights an action in motion, which later broadened into grammatical uses marking result or degree.

examples.chinese: 他汉字写得很好(他漢字寫得很好)。
examples.pinyin: Tā Hànzì xiě de hěn hǎo.
examples.english: He writes Chinese characters very well.

examples.chinese: 我得到了奖(我得到了獎)。
